channel.title: piscinae on Gardens of the Roman Empire
channel.description: Recent content in piscinae on Gardens of the Roman Empire

item.title: Urban House or Schola in Aquincum
item.description: Province Pannonia Province Description Location Aquincum Aquincum (Pleiades) Location Description This town on the Danube river acquired the rank of municipium under Hadrian in 124 A.D. In the year 194 it was granted colonial status. Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Urban House or Schola in Aquincum Keywords bathhouses (water recreation structures) fountains peristyles (Roman courtyards) piscinae Garden Description Very few houses of Mediterranean type have been discovered, and only one can be said with certainty to have had a garden (Fig.

item.title: Structures under the Collège Lumière in Vesontio
item.description: Province Germania Superior Province Description Location Vesontio Vesontio (Pleiades) Location Description The defensibility offered by this unique geography made Caesar hasten to occupy Vesontio in 58 BC. The town came to have all the usual Roman structures– forum, baths, aqueduct, and amphitheater (on the other side of the Doubs, to the northwest.) But the most visible remnant is the Porte Noire (Black Gate) [3], a triumphal arch built by Marcus Aurelius at the southeastern end of the cardo maximus, today Grande Rue and still the center of city life.

item.title: House in the Rue du Palais de Justice in Vesontio
item.description: Province Germania Superior Province Description Location Vesontio Vesontio (Pleiades) Location Description The defensibility offered by this unique geography made Caesar hasten to occupy Vesontio in 58 BC. The town came to have all the usual Roman structures– forum, baths, aqueduct, and amphitheater (on the other side of the Doubs, to the northwest.) But the most visible remnant is the Porte Noire (Black Gate) [3], a triumphal arch built by Marcus Aurelius at the southeastern end of the cardo maximus, today Grande Rue and still the center of city life.

item.title: Villa in Vallon (Sur Dompierre, Canton de Fribourg, Switzerland)
item.description: Province Germania Superior Province Description Location Vallon Vallon (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Villa in Vallon (Sur Dompierre, Canton de Fribourg, Switzerland) Keywords arbors barrier walls ceramic tile fences (site elements) hearths horrea mosaics (visual works) pedestals pillars piscinae porticoes rural villas sherds tesserae villae rusticae water supply systems Garden Description Located 6km south-east of Avenches/ Aventicum, the capital of the Helvetian tribe, this site is situated on a small alluvial terrace at the bottom of a hillside.

item.title: Rural Villa in Dietikon
item.description: Province Germania Superior Province Description Location Dietikon Dietikon (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural Villa in Dietikon Keywords axial plan piscinae porticoes rural villas villae rusticae Garden Description This villa rustica complex was built on a site at the bottom of a valley near and parallel to the river Limmat. Dietikon was situated on an important land and water traffic route from the Bündner Alps to Vindonissa and further north to the Rhine.

item.title: House in Insula 13 in Aventicum
item.description: Province Germania Superior Province Description Location Aventicum Aventicum (Pleiades) Location Description The town was established in the Augustan period as the civitas capital of the Helvetii. At this time the orthogonal street grid was laid out. Most probably in AD 71, it became Colonia Pia Flavia Constans Emerita Helvetiorum Foederata. The town was destroyed or badly damaged around AD 260, and it was progressively abandoned thereafter. Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden House in Insula 13 in Aventicum

item.title: Tomb Garden and Pool of Cingius Iustinus
item.description: Province Dalmatia Province Description Location Salona Salona (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Tomb Garden and Pool of Cingius Iustinus Keywords piscinae tombs epitaphs Garden Description A rock cut inscription at Salonae marks the spot where some time in the late second or third century Cingius Iustinus made a fishpond or pool (piscina) in the garden of his wife Aelia Licinia for her and for himself (fecit piscinam in horto Aeliae Liciniae coiugi incomparabili et sibi).

item.title: Palatial House in Insula 7 in Aventicum
item.description: Province Germania Superior Province Description Location Aventicum Aventicum (Pleiades) Location Description The town was established in the Augustan period as the civitas capital of the Helvetii. At this time the orthogonal street grid was laid out. Most probably in AD 71, it became Colonia Pia Flavia Constans Emerita Helvetiorum Foederata. The town was destroyed or badly damaged around AD 260, and it was progressively abandoned thereafter. Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Palatial House in Insula 7 in Aventicum

item.title: Rural Villa at Neerhaaren-Rekem
item.description: Province Germania inferior Location Neerhaaren-Rekem Neerhaaren-Rekem (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural villa at Neerhaaren-Rekem Keywords rural villas villae rusticae arbors pergolas piscinae Garden Description The facade of this modest house of a villa rustica near the Meuse river measured 24 m. in length and had two protruding wings joined by a portico (Plan 1). The house was built in the late 1st century A.D. There is evidence for an arbor or pergola next to the house in the form of two rows of postholes arranged diagonally and converging in front of the entrance on the west (circles on plan).

item.title: Urban House on Gertrudenstrasse
item.description: Province Germania inferior Location Cologne Cologne (Pleiades) Location Description This large town on the west bank of the Rhine river was the civitas capital of the Ubii in the first half of the 1st century A.D. It was granted the status of colonia by Claudius in 50 and became the provincial capital in 85. Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Urban house on Gertrudenstrasse (Colonia Claudia Ara Agrippinensium) Keywords urban villas villae urbanae

item.title: Roman Palace in Fishbourne
item.description: Province Britannia Province Description Location Fishbourne Fishbourne (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Roman Palace in Fishbourne Keywords colonnades palaces piscinae Garden Description Fishbourne Roman Palace was accidentally discovered during the digging of a water main trench in 1960. The discovery led to nine seasons of excavations (1961-69) that showed the site had developed from a military base at the time of the Roman invasion in AD 43 to a sumptuous palace by the end of the first century CE.

Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Atrium House (Colonia Claudia Ara Agrippinensium) Keywords urban villas villae urbanae atrium houses

item.title: Rural Villa in Eccles
item.description: Province Britannia Province Description Location Eccles Eccles (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural Villa in Eccles Keywords piscinae villae rusticae water baths Garden Description This country estate in modern Kent possessed a large ornamental pool (P in Fig. 1) in the area in front of the main residence (A in Fig. 1) and to the east of the attached bath house (Fig. 1). The masonry pool measuring 25 x 3.

item.title: Rural Villa in Darenth
item.description: Province Britannia Province Description Location Darenth Darenth (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural Villa in Darenth Keywords piscinae villae rusticae waterspouts Garden Description Excavations at this site of a Roman villa in Kent uncovered a large rectangular masonry pool in the courtyard, which was enclosed by buildings on the north, west, and east (Fig. 1). The villa buildings took up an area of 150 x 225 meters in total, including the courtyard with a width of 26.

item.title: Rural Villa in Bancroft
item.description: Province Britannia Province Description Location Bancroft Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural Villa in Bancroft Keywords bathhouses (water recreation structures) gazebos piscinae villae rusticae Garden Description Excavations between 1983 and 1986 at this site in Buckinghamshire revealed a Roman villa of the winged corridor type, which was built in the late 3rd century and rebuilt and enlarged in the mid-4th century (Fig.1). From the two projecting wings of the house at the northeast and southeast two walls ran eastward, forming an enclosed courtyard 35.
